snippet: Traffic deaths in the United States rose 9.3 percent in the first nine months of 2015 compared with a year earlier as low gasoline prices increased road travel.
abstract: National Highway Traffic Safety Administration says traffic deaths in United States totaled 26,000 in first nine months of 2015, up 9.3 percent from year ago.
lead_paragraph: Traffic deaths in the United States rose 9.3 percent in the first nine months of 2015 compared with a year earlier as low gasoline prices increased road travel.

headline.main: Traffic Deaths Rise as More Travelers Take to Road
